item.title: Comment on The Declining Relative Quality of the Child Care Workforce by L
item.description:
I don't need my children's teachers to have a 4 year degree or exceptionally high cognitive skills. That's just going to artificially inflate costs with credentialing and select for the wrong things.

My kids need patience, empathy, love for the content, the profession, and kids in general. These have nothing to do with cognitive skills and 4 year degrees

that wasn’t specifically what i said. simply, it is almost impossible to have alpha w people above a certain age since there are sufficient data points to assess them accurately.

"I'm not saying don't hire people over 30, I'm just saying that if you hire people over 30, you won't get any exceptional performance for your money". I think that's dubious empirically - and is still probably age discrimination.

"Don't hire people over 30" basically means "don't hire people who have children, because they will have meaning in their lives beyond shipping your product"
